alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 11:39AM EDT until July 30 at 1:27PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson affecting Breathitt County. South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This is a flood of record. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 41.3 feet, Many homes are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 42.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EDT Friday was 43.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 4.4 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.0 feet on 05/08/1984. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 5 PM EDT.
